fields.planned_diversity_expenditures:
We are actively seeking diverse suppliers who can meet the needs of our specific capital projects:

-Building Expansion 
-Air Handler installation and removal  
-Internal Renovation Projects 
-Life Safety Code corrections 
-Infrastructure Upgrades 
-Installation of Hybrid Cath Lab
-Bathroom and patient room upgrade 
-Bi-Plane installation 
-Project planning studies for potential future projects
-Material suppliers
fields.plan_for_diversity_recruitment:
Ascension leaders, in partnership with The Resource Group (supplies/services) and Medxcel (facilities) continue to monitor diverse supplier spending and are committed to on-going improvements.  Resources have been dedicated to this pursuit, and goals are being developed in partnership with hospital and system leadership, as well as local and state agencies as required.

We are working with the IHA Supplier Diversity Task-force, which is looking to engage more deeply in diversity supply chain discussions and share best practices.

We are also working with West Side United, an organization that has a mission to improve neighborhood health by addressing inequities in healthcare, education, economic vitality and the physical environment particularly focused on the West Side of Chicago.  Ascension will work with WSU on aligned procurement efforts to ensure that M/WBE companies are afforded opportunities to contract/ subcontract for specific projects over the next several years throughout our health system.
fields.challenges_to_diversity_recruitment:
A significant challenge is finding companies that have the expertise and qualifications to work within the regulatory requirements of hospital services, particularly those qualified vendors that can handle large scale construction projects.

The COVID-19 pandemic and the associated response have also drawn resources towards short-term challenges as each surge has presented itself.  The associated supply chain interruptions, higher material costs and business closures have impacted processes that were previously more straightforward.
fields.hsfrb_assistance:
The Board could help by providing a link with organizations that are, or can become, “hospital ready,” and provide that listing to the hospitals and hospital systems on a regular basis. Identifying and regularly sharing lists of diverse suppliers that have a history of work conducted at other anchor hospitals would also be helpful.

In addition, if multiple anchor hospitals are able to identify the need for a particular trade for which a diverse supplier is not available, perhaps training can be done on a larger scale for those companies who would like to develop the capacity to fill the need for for all hospitals that may have a similar need.
fields.certifications: We recognize all certifications from third-party agencies, including NMSDC,WBENC, MVBDC, utility companies and all other various certifying agencies. Credentialing can be shared with Medxcel and Ascension's GPO, The Resource Group.
fields.point_of_contact:
Michael Bathe
Project Manager
Medxcel

 
Michael.Bathe@medxcel.com
fields.enrollment_process:
Contact Michael Bathe at Michael.Bathe@medxcel.com,

Also, for opportunities outside of construction and related services, vendors may access The Resource Group Supplier Registration Portal:

https://www.theresourcegroup.com/suppliers/supplier-registration-portal

Ascension leaders, in partnership with The Resource Group (supplies/services) and Medxcel (facilities) continue to monitor diverse supplier spending and are committed to on-going improvements.  Resources have been dedicated to this pursuit, and goals are being developed in partnership with hospital and system leadership, as well as local and state agencies as required.

We are working with the IHA Supplier Diversity Task-force, which is looking to engage more deeply in diversity supply chain discussions and share best practices.

We are also working with West Side United, an organization that has a mission to improve neighborhood health by addressing inequities in healthcare, education, economic vitality and the physical environment particularly focused on the West Side of Chicago. raw.Challenges to Diversity Recruitment:
A significant challenge is finding companies that have the expertise and qualifications to work within the regulatory requirements of hospital services, particularly those qualified vendors that can handle large scale construction projects.

The COVID-19 pandemic and the associated response have also drawn resources towards short-term challenges as each surge has presented itself.  The associated supply chain interruptions, higher material costs and business closures have impacted processes that were previously more straightforward.
